required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laryngeal Mask Airway Versus Air Q Laryngeal Airway
clinical_study.official_title: Laryngeal Mask Airway Versus Air Q Laryngeal Airway in Dacryocystorhinostomy

brief_summary.textblock: Nowadays, supraglottic airway devices are simple and effective alternatives to endotracheal intubation. Both laryngeal mask airway LMA and air-Q airway are supraglottic airway devices that can be used to maintain and protect airways from aspiration of secretions and blood during DCR surgery. The present study was designed to compare standard LMA versus air Q as regards the sealing effect and aspiration of blood in DCR surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: 72 patients were divided into two groups, 36 patients each, named LMA group, and air Q group according to supraglottic devices used. The following parameters were recorded in both studied groups, continuous Electrocardiography (ECG), heart rate (HR), means arterial pressure (MAP), arterial oxygen saturation (SpO2), end tidal carbon di-oxide (PCO2)..Oro pharyngeal leak pressure in (cmH2O), exhaled tidal volume in (ml), leak volume in (ml), leak fraction in (%) number of shifting from LMA to air Q or ETT and shifting from air Q to LMA or ETT was recorded with absence or presence of surgical blood on The undersurface of the device used.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Just after insertion of supraglottic airway devices
primary_outcome.description: By setting the pop-off valve to limit peak airway pressure to 40 cm H2O and allowing airway pressure to increase at a fresh gas flow of 3 L/min until audible noise was heard over the mouth and no further increase in airway pressure is observed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Just after insertion of supraglottic airway devices
secondary_outcome.description: Leak fraction in (%)( Leak was calculated by subtracting the expiratory volume from the inspiratory volume and expressed as a fraction of the inspiratory volume). were evaluated just before surgery

arm_group.description: 36 patients were ventilated with LMA during dacryocystorhinostomy surgery
36 patients each were ventilated with air Q airway during dacryocystorhinostomy surgery

intervention.description: patients were ventilated with AirQ airway

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Both sex
- Age: 18-60 years
- ASA I-II
- Patients scheduled for dacryocystorhinostomy surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any pathology of the neck, upper respiratory tract, upper alimentary tract
- Patients with a history of gastric regurgitation, heartburn
- Morbid obese,
- Patients with esophageal reflux (hiatus hernia)
- Anticipating difficult airway management
- Patients with coagulation disorders
